metadata.title: CVE-2017-0360 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
file_open in Tryton 3.x and 4.x through 4.2.2 allows remote authenticatedusers with certain permissions to read arbitrary files via a "same rootname but with a suffix" attack. NOTE: This vulnerability exists because ofan incomplete fix for CVE-2016-1242.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-0360` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tryton-server - 4.2.1-2
tryton-server-all-in-one - 4.2.1-2
tryton-server-nginx - 4.2.1-2
tryton-server-postgresql - 4.2.1-2
tryton-server-uwsgi - 4.2.1-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tryton-server package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.1-2').
